Footage showing the moment of a Russian Geran-2 drone strike on a high-rise residential building in the Pozniaky District of Kyiv.
Another high-rise building can be seen burning in the background from an earlier strike.
At least 5 civilians have been injured so far.

3 Tu-95MS carried out launch maneuvers around 10 minutes ago, likely from southern Nizhny Novgorod Oblast.  If the launches were real and not simulated, missiles should enter Ukrainian airspace in the next 2 hours.   Kyiv was under attack from missiles earlier‚Ä¶

Last night and this morning, another large-scale, combined Russian missile and drone attack was carried out on Ukraine.
Missiles launched:
~10 Kh-101 cruise missiles launched from 5 Tu-95MS strategic bombers at their launch lines in Kalachyovksy District, Volgograd Oblast.
~8 Kh-101 cruise missiles launched from 2 Tu-160 strategic bombers at their launch lines in Kalachyovksy District, Volgograd Oblast.
~6 Kh-101 cruise missiles launched from 3 Tu-95MS strategic bombers at their launch lines in Ulyanovsk Oblast.
~4 Iskander-M ballistic missiles launched from OTRK installations in the vicinity of Bryansk City, Bryansk Oblast.
~4 Kalibr cruise missiles launched from 1 "Varshavyanka" Submarine at least 50 km off the coast of Myskhako, Krasnodar Krai.
~4 Iskander-K cruise missiles launched from OTRK installations near Liski, Voronezh Oblast.
~2 Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missiles launched from 2 MiG-31K fighters at their launch lines in Rasskazovsky District, Tambov Oblast.
~2 Kh-32 cruise missiles launched from 2 Tu-22m3 strategic bombers at their launch lines southwest of Sevastopol over the Black Sea.
-----------------------
Ukrainian air defence work:
As of the time of writing, Ukrainian air defence is confirmed to have intercepted at least 4 Kh-101 cruise missiles and 1 Iskander-M ballistic missile.
-----------------------
The main targets for this strike were Ukrainian energy infrastructure and airbases. The following was targeted:
CHP-5 Power & Heat Plant, Kyiv Oblast (50.39403, 30.56928) by ~9 Kh-101s & 4 Kalibrs.
Trypillya Thermal Power Plant, Kyiv Oblast (50.13416, 30.74705) by ~4 Iskander-K cruise missiles.
CHP-4 Power and Heat Plant, Kyiv Oblast (50.44693, 30.64255) by 3 Kh-101s & 1 Iskander-M.
CHP-6 Power and Heat Plant, Kyiv Oblast (50.53188, 30.66309) by 2 Iskander-Ms.
"Kyiv" 750 kV electrical substation, Kyiv Oblast (50.49441, 29.69235) by ~5 Kh-101s.
Kyiv Hydroelectric Power Plant, Kyiv Oblast (50.58763, 30.50767) by ~3 Kh-101s
Ozerne Airbase, Zhytomyr Oblast (50.15999, 28.73766) by ~2 Kinzhals.
Black Sea Oil Platforms  (45.3591, 30.9033) by ~2 Kh-32s.
-----------------------
Keep in mind, the numbers of missiles launched may be slightly higher than what I've listed, as the number of missiles detected is often lower than actual launches.

The Russian Volunteer Corps announced that their leader Denis "WhiteRex" Kapustin was killed along the Zaporizhzhia frontline after he was struck by a Russian FPV drone. 
@wfwitness

Footage showing the moment of a Russian Geran-2 drone strike on a high-rise residential building in the Pozniaky District of Kyiv.  Another high-rise building can be seen burning in the background from an earlier strike.  At least 5 civilians have been injured‚Ä¶

Steady flight speed, flying on an angle consistent with targeted strikes, explodes with a fireball consistent with targeted strikes, and there is another residential building burning in the background.
Looks like a targeted strike on civilian infrastructure to me, rather than electronic warfare interference.
Take with a grain of salt as Skala is one of the most notorious liars among Ukrainian units, but there have been significant Ukrainian redeployments to Hulyaipole from the Dobropillya direction.

A large fire is burning at the CHP-5 Power Plant in Kyiv. 
CHP-5 bore the brunt of the Russian missile and drone attacks, getting hit by approximately 13 cruise missiles.
Russian forces have launched assaults into the town of Novoandreyevka, Orekhov direction of Zaporozhye oblast. The success of these attacks is yet to be determined.

Footage showing a Russian Geran-2 drone strike on a warehouse complex on the outskirts of Kyiv this morning.
Coordinates: 50.53962, 30.59551

Consequences of Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on the Darnytsia Tram Depot in Kyiv. 
Coordinates: 50.44505, 30.63294

Consequences of Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on the Darnytsia Tram Depot in Kyiv. 
Coordinates: 50.44505, 30.63294
Footage showing the moment of a Russian Geran-2 drone strike on an open area in Bila Tserkva, Kyiv Oblast.
Footage showing the moment of a Russian Geran-2 drone strike on an open area in Bila Tserkva, Kyiv Oblast.
As a result of the recent Russian combined missile and drone attack, around 600,000 consumers in Kyiv Oblast are currently without power. Work is underway to restore power supply.
A large fire is burning at an enterprise in Bila Tserkva, Kyiv Oblast, following Russian Geran-2 drone strikes.
A large fire is burning at an enterprise in Bila Tserkva, Kyiv Oblast, following Russian Geran-2 drone strikes.
Extremely close call from a Geran-2 drone in Kyiv.

Myrne, Polohy direction. Another interesting correction.
Ukrainian forces control Myrne: Barbed wire placement is observed from early October to mid-November in the white circles of photo #1.
This cannot be placement by the Russian side because:
1. The wire has been placed in a half arch pointing south and is itself located south of Myrne
2. Russian forces basically never place barbed wire in long lines and at most surround their individual dugout or trench. The only place where this has been found is in their Surovikin line, a case that definitely doesn't apply here.
The frontline drawn is extremely approximate and will be subject to changes in the future if more information becomes available.
This also lines up with this post: 
https://t.me/ShalinW/6872

In the Rai-Oleksandrivka direction, Russian forces continued to advance and have made significant progress in three different areas over the last 10 days.
In the northeast, Ukrainian forces completed their withdrawal from the salient encompassing the 2023 fortifications northeast of Zaliznyanske, allowing for the Russians to consolidate in the strongpoints there. From there, they began pushing further northwest to the next forest over, while assault groups on the flanks improved their positions in the treelines.
To the west, Russian forces continued attacking northwest from the area of Orikhovo-Vasylivka, capturing numerous treeline positions and entrenching in the first houses on southern Minkivka. With support from assault groups clearing the treelines to the south, Russian forces continued pushing west and northwest from their foothold, clearing additional positions and entering the central and southwestern parts of the village. 
Additionally, the Russians established control over the treelines southeast and east of Minkivka and began a push up the E-40 Highway in the direction of Pryvillya, which Russian DRGs have already entered. They also managed to clear the rest of the fortified forest along the highway and consolidated in the remaining positions to the southeast. 
In the southwest, Russian forces infiltrated the village of Novomarkove from their positions northwest of the village along the southern bank of the Siverskyi-Donets Canal. Other forces then entered its southern houses, allowing for it to be brought under full Russian control. They also improved their positions in the treelines to the south. 
+ ~16.27 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.

The Russian MOD has now resorted to Ukraine-like informational tactics regarding Kupyansk. 
"Continuing to destroy small groups, hiding in the holes"
"The city is under our control"
"Clearing of basement premises"
Sound familiar?
These must be some titan-like troops to be valiently carrying out these operations all while being encircled in multiple pockets. 
This is yet another example of why you should NEVER consider any official government source as a reliable source when trying to accurately determine the true situation somewhere. 
The narrative will likely change to "we withdrew to more advantageous positions across the Oskil River" in the coming weeks. It's all damage control.

Ukraine Has Lost Nearly All of Huliaipole (Videos)
On December 26, the Russian military extended its control over most of the center and northern part of Huliaipole in Zaporozhye, and advanced in its eastern part, reducing the area under Ukrainian control to less than 20 percent of the city.
Videos posted online confirmed that Russian troops from the Vostok [East] Group of Forces have reached the Nestor Makhno statues at the heart of Huliaipole ‚Äì also known as Gulyaypole -, as well as the ‚ÄúI Love Huliaipole‚Äù sign in the northern part of the city.
Just a day earlier, the troops broke through Ukrainian defenses in Sobornaya Street in the city center and captured the headquarters of Ukraine‚Äôs 102nd Territorial Defense Brigade. Kiev forces withdrew in a rush leaving behind everything, including their communication equipment, which explains their later collapse in the nearby areas.
üëâ

Elite Russian Drone Unit Eliminates Ukrainian Tank Gathering Near Kostiantynivka (Videos)
The Center for Advanced Unmanned Technologies ‚ÄúRubicon‚Äù announced on December 26 that it has destroyed more than two dozen Ukrainian armored vehicles which were gathered in the Kostiantynivka direction in Donetsk in a well-planned special operation.
The gathering was near the city of Druzhkivka, a logistics and command hub of Kiev forces located right to the north of the city of Kostiantynivka where the Russian military‚Äôs Yug [South] Group of Forces is currently advancing.
Rubicon said that the gathering was discovered by one of its drone pilots on December 20, and was quickly targeted in an attack that went on for hours.

Key Heights And Forests: Russian Army Makes Tactical Moves Against Ukrainian Forces In Slaviansk
In the Kharkiv sector, Russian units are achieving tactical success by advancing south of Vilcha towards Hrafskyi and capturing strongpoints in forested areas. In the Slaviansk sector, after establishing control over Sviato-Pokrovske, assault groups have reached the eastern part of Reznykivka. They are conducting fierce fighting in Zakotne and the Bondarne area. In the Zaporizhzhia sector, Kosivtsiv was taken under control. 
In Huliaipole, units established control over a significant part of the city, including a captured headquarters. In the Sumy sector, advances of up to 600 meters have been noted in several areas, including Andriivka. Meanwhile, the Ukrainian command is attempting to reinforce defenses and prevent troop withdrawals. 
Kyiv's European allies plan to finalize a package of security guarantees for Ukraine in January 2026.
Read more 
HERE

Survival Among One‚Äôs Own: Extrajudicial Punishments In The Ukrainian Armed Forces
After forced mobilization and brief ‚Äî often merely formal ‚Äî training at training centers, a new survival quest begins for many Ukrainian servicemen. This struggle is shaped not only by frontline combat but also by harsh internal rules within their own units. 
A stark example of the punitive system in some Ukrainian Armed Forces (AFU) units surfaced in a video circulated in December 2025. It shows a serviceman pointing to a deep earthen pit, describing it as standard punishment for offenders in his unit. Offenders are forced to dig the hole themselves, then lowered into it; the ladder is removed, and they are left there for 24 hours ‚Äî without food, water, or warm clothing amid winter cold. 
Another video, trophy footage recovered by Russian forces from a deceased Ukrainian soldier's phone, depicts tactical fighters conducting a "debriefing" with mobilized offenders.
üëâ

Israel Advances Plans To Displace Gazans, Fight Houthis With Recognition Of Somaliland 
Israel on December 26 become the first country to recognize the Republic of Somaliland as an independent state, in what may be the first step in a plan to permanently displace Palestinians from the Gaza Strip to the Horn of Africa and escalate military operations against the Houthis (Ansar Allah) in Yemen.
Somaliland, which claims the northwestern portion of Somalia, declared independence from the country in 1991, but has failed until the accord with Israel to secure the recognition of any United Nations member state.
According to Israel‚Äôs Channel 12, talks between the two sides gained momentum as Israel searched for countries willing to take in Gazans it was looking to move out of the Strip.
This is, of course, not everything Israel may be getting from the accord. Somaliland is located less than 300 kilometers away from Yemen‚Äôs Red Sea coast that is mostly controlled by the Iran-aligned Houthis.
Read more 
HERE
